Docs.summary: A material applies a blur affect to anything rendered using it.
Docs.remarks: A horizontal or vertical blur may be applied, but not both at the same time. To blur in both directions, use a object for multi-phase drawing.

Docs.param: If provided, always use the custom shader instead of the default blur shader.
When blurring a textured object, a texture must be specified.

The blur shader needs to know the size of each texel so it can calculate blur radius propertly. This is normally equal to 1 / texture width for horizontal blur and 1 / texture height for vertical blur.
